title: Executive/Senior Executive, Marketing
description_html:
Joining C&C is a distinctive opportunity to develop your career within a successful organization where everyone respects each other and enjoys working together. We recognize your performance in both tangible and intangible ways, by providing you development opportunities and making you feel respected.

The Opportunity

Are you a creative, detail-oriented, and results-driven marketing professional? Do you thrive in a dynamic environment where every campaign you launch contributes directly to business success?

We’re looking for a Marketing Executive who can juggle multiple projects, coordinate seamlessly with stakeholders, and execute exciting online and offline marketing initiatives. If you love crafting compelling brand stories, working closely with sales teams, and driving consumer engagement, this role is for you!

 

Your Role & Responsibilities 

·       Sales Collaboration & Product Positioning: Work closely with the Sales Management team to define clear product positioning for brand and retail campaigns.

·       Campaign Performance Tracking: Analyze and report on campaign effectiveness, providing insights to optimize future activations.

·       Lead Generation & Awareness: Collaborate with performance marketing team and digital agencies to drive traffic and generate leads.

·       Marketing Collateral Management: Ensure timely delivery of high-quality marketing materials that engage and inform customers.

·       Event & Roadshow Coordination: Plan and execute memorable events that create buzz and engagement.

·       Agency & Vendor Management: Collaborate with creative agencies, media partners, and event organizers to bring campaigns to life. Provide clear and insight-driven briefs creative agencies, ensuring messaging aligns with business objectives and resonates with the target audience.

title: Automotive Technician 汽车技术员
description_html:
Joining C&C is a distinctive opportunity to develop your career within a successful organization where everyone respects each other and enjoys working together. We recognize your performance in both tangible and intangible ways, by providing you development opportunities and making you feel respected.

The Opportunity

As a technician with Cycle & Carriage Singapore, you will be responsible for providing installation, testing, maintenance and repair jobs that comply with customers’ requirements and manufacturers’ specifications.
 
• Carry out maintenance service and repair job, and report any other defects found during the course of repair
• Able to perform electrical installation jobs and troubleshooting/ rectification of installation problems
• Able to carry out medium to complex diagnostics works as assigned by Superior
• To be accountable for all parts or materials used; as well as customers’ vehicle and belongings during the process of repair
• Carry out optimum quality check on all vehicles before delivery
• Ensure all vehicles are road worthy within manufacturer standard & specification
• Complies to all rules and regulations stipulated by the company on general code of conduct and safety

title: HRIS Operations Lead (Operations, PMO, Reporting & Vendor)
description_html:
Joining C&C is a distinctive opportunity to develop your career within a successful organization where everyone respects each other and enjoys working together. We recognize your performance in both tangible and intangible ways, by providing you development opportunities and making you feel respected.

HRIS Operations Lead (Operations, PMO, Reporting & Vendor)

Department: People & Culture
Location: Singapore
Reports to: Head of People & Culture
Direct Report: HRIS Analyst (1 FTE, Singapore)
Works with: HR functional teams, IT (Singapore & Malaysia), Payroll/Finance, Vendors

About The Role

This is a newly created operational role with one direct report based in Singapore. You will keep our people technology stack reliable and purposeful, and move improvements forward at a steady, practical pace. This role sits with HR Ops teams (not shared services environment) and you are comfortable working in a business-first user environment.

 

Pillar 1 — Manage the People Tech Stack (end‑to‑end lifecycle)


Own day‑to‑day operations across the employee lifecycle (hire → move → pay → develop → exit), including data management, audit & compliance, security/access, and system governance. Summarised as follows:

  • Operate the stack: HCM Suite (System of Record), Payroll (incl. OT), ATS, Recognition, Employee Communication.
  • Configuration & environments: Own safe changes in sandbox → prod (roles/permissions, workflows, rules, reference data) with documented checks and regression packs.
  • Data management: Run routine data quality checks; fix root causes; maintain a simple data dictionary and naming standards.
  • Audit & compliance: Prepare evidence for internal/external audits; ensure PDPA/privacy and RBAC (role‑based access) controls are followed.
  • System governance: Keep a monthly release calendar (with payroll/comp freeze windows); maintain a lightweight config log, test scripts, release notes, rollback plan.
  • UAT model: HRIS runs unit, system, and primary UAT; HR functional teams perform the final business check & sign‑off.
  • Partnering with IT (SG & MY): Coordinate where changes touch integrations, IAM/SSO, or infrastructure—IT leads the technical build; HRIS prepares HR side (data, config, UAT).

Pillar 2 — Project Management Cadence


Plan and track HR tech changes using pragmatic PMO practices: project charters, timelines, budgets, and clear roles & responsibilities—with regular status updates. Summarised as follows:

  • Project charter: Define scope, outcomes, roles & responsibilities, budget, timeline, and risks (RAID).
  • Cadence: Maintain simple weekly status and monthly prioritisation with HR; escalate early and avoid scope creep.
  • Budget management: Track spend vs. plan (licences, change requests, small enhancement work); flag variances with options.
  • R&R clarity: Align who does what (HRIS, HR teams, IT SG/MY, vendor); document decisions and hand‑offs.

Pillar 3 — Reporting

Own centralised HR reporting and handle the consolidation and on‑time submission of all statutory/corporate reports, ensuring accuracy and audit readiness. Summarised as follows:

  • HR reporting dashboard: Update dashboards in existing platforms (e.g., headcount, movements, attrition, vacancies, OT where relevant) with agreed definitions.
  • Statutory & corporate submissions: Work with Functional Pillar Managers to consolidate and submit Singapore statutory reporting timely for all entities in SG; reconcile with Payroll/Finance and keep audit trails.

Pillar 4 — Vendor Partnership & Cost Management


Manage vendors day‑to‑day (SLAs, releases, fixes) and track costs and utilisation, including being responsible for handling inter‑company cost‑charging timely and accurately.

  • Operational partnership: Raise/track tickets, review release notes, plan safe feature adoption, verify fixes; maintain SLAs. Partake in vendor renewal discussions and procurement, where relevant.
  • Commercial hygiene: Track licence/utilisation, small change orders, and annual renewals; prepare inputs for budgeting.
  • Inter‑co charging: Maintain a simple log and basis for inter‑company cost‑charging where applicable; align with Finance for cost recoveries.

Requirements

  • At least 9 years in HRIS with hands‑on HCM (e.g., Workday, or similar), including configuration, testing, and releases. Preferably sitting in HR environment.
  • Clear understanding and application of PMO basics and has relevant communication and interpersonal skills to support/work with users on project charters.
  • Operationally able to handle multiple data sets for statutory reporting independently and timely.
  • Has a keen sense on security & compliance: PDPA/privacy practices, RBAC controls, and audit readiness.
  • Able to partner vendors on issues and costing models in a practical and fit-for-purpose manner, including cadence on inter‑company chargeback concepts.
  • Understand how integrations/SSO/infrastructure work conceptually and collaborate with IT in Singapore & Malaysia.
  • Able to use clear, user-friendly language in communication such as release notes and user updates; simple enablement materials; steady follow‑through.
  • Hands‑on, organised, people‑first; “all hands-on deck” when needed; keeps documentation tidy and routines predictable. Embrace / educate adoption of people technology to advance use cases from concept to application.
  • Only Singaporeans

About the Company

A member of the Jardine Cycle & Carriage Group, C&C is one of the leading automotive groups in Singapore. We started out in 1899 as a trader in nutmegs and other sundries. In more than 120 years since, we have grown to become a major player in the automotive industry in Singapore, retailing Mercedes-Benz, Mitsubishi, Kia, Citroën, Maxus, ORA, smart passenger cars and Commercial vehicles as well as retail used cars under its Republic Auto brand.

At Cycle & Carriage, it is more than just the recognition we have earned as being the leader in its class. "Exceptional Journeys" encapsulates our passion for our existence. Bringing together high-performing team members and technical excellence to create people-focused experiences that consistently exceed expectations. Whether it is a customer we serve, an employee that we engage, a brand that we carry, we want to support them in creating exceptional journeys for themselves.

We have a constant mission to strive towards being an Employer of Choice in the countries we operate in. Some of our better performing countries have consistently being recognized for commendable people practices such as:

  • HR Asia's Best Companies to Work Platinum Award in 2025 (11th consecutive year winner)
  • Happiest Workplace Award 2024
  • Finalist in HR Excellence Awards 2016 for Recruitment and Leadership Development;
  • Winner of Innovative Talent Acquisition Strategy Award in the Annual Jardine Matheson HR Conference 2016
  • Winner of Excellence In Innovative Use of HR Technology in HR Excellence Awards 2017
  • Merit for Singapore Health Award as awarded by Health Promotion Board
  • Jardine Matheson HR Conference 2017, where we clinched the Best Employer Brand, Best Work-Life Balance and Best HR Team Awards.
  • Jardine Matheson HR Conference 2018 for Excellence in Employee Transformation
  • Bronze Award in HR Excellence Award 2019 for Excellence in HR Innovation

 

The emphasis on employee experience has been on the forefront of the C&C's people practices. Keen for a career conversation? Connect with us to find out more.

(You would be notified if you are shortlisted. By submitting your application, you consent to the collection, use and disclosure of your personal data contained in this document by Jardine Cycle & Carriage Limited and its subsidiaries and affiliates, for assessing your career application)

title: Officer - Customer Service (Temp Boutique Sales)
description_html:
Joining C&C is a distinctive opportunity to develop your career within a successful organization where everyone respects each other and enjoys working together. We recognize your performance in both tangible and intangible ways, by providing you development opportunities and making you feel respected.

The Opportunity

We are looking for a dedicated Officer - Customer Service to be part of the Mercedes-Benz customer service team. You will be taking on the boutique sales portfolio. Being in a dynamic environment, you are expected to adapt, pick up and apply new skills and knowledge which will be necessary to your success in this role. The Job:
• Provide first-class customer service and knowledgeable insights to customers regarding merchandise
• Manage and drive promotions and sales for Boutique and eShop
• Assist customers in enquiries for boutique and eShop sales
• Handle cashiering duties, manage, and keep proper records of daily inventory figures and balance
• Organise and keep track on the boutique and eShop inventory level and re-stock when needed
• Manage reservation orders and proactively updating status to customers
• Ensure stock accuracy with monthly stock takes
• Support assist and to work with the customer service and sales teams to improve customer experience level


Requirements:
• Minimum GCE ‘O’ Levels and above with preferably at least 2 years of retail service experience
• Demonstrate good communication skills with excellent customer service attitude
• Besides well-versed in English, fluency in Chinese/ local dialects will be advantageous in order to liaise with Chinese-speaking associates

About the Company

A member of the Jardine Cycle & Carriage Group, C&C is one of the leading automotive groups in Singapore. We started out in 1899 as a trader in nutmegs and other sundries. In more than 100 years since, we have grown to become a major player in the automotive industry in Singapore, retailing Mercedes-Benz, Mitsubishi, Kia and Citroën passenger cars and commercial vehicles. At Cycle & Carriage, it is more than just the recognition we have earned as being the leader in its class. "Exceptional Journeys" encapsulates our passion for our existence. Bringing together high-performing team members and technical excellence to create people-focused experiences that consistently exceed expectations. Whether it is a customer we serve, an employee that we engage, a brand that we carry, we want to support them in creating exceptional journeys for themselves.

We have a constant mission to strive towards being an Employer of Choice in the countries we operate in. Some of our better performing countries have consistently being recognised for commendable people practices such as:
• HR Asia’s Best Companies to Work for 5 consecutive years in 2015, 2016, 2017, 2018 and 2019;
• Finalist in HR Excellence Awards 2016 for Recruitment and Leadership Development;
• Winner of Innovative Talent Acquisition Strategy Award in the Annual Jardine Matheson HR Conference 2016

• Merit for Singapore Health Award as awarded by Health Promotion Board

• Jardine Matheson HR Conference 2018 for Excellence in Employee Transformation
• Bronze Award in HR Excellence Award 2019 for Excellence in HR Innovation

title: Senior Executive / Executive – Total Rewards
description_html:
Joining C&C is a distinctive opportunity to develop your career within a successful organization where everyone respects each other and enjoys working together. We recognize your performance in both tangible and intangible ways, by providing you development opportunities and making you feel respected.

 

The Opportunity
You aspire to develop & contribute your Total Rewards (TR) expertise with a forward-looking organization. You will be part of the team in championing TR activities and be responsible for seamless TR operations to support the entire user experience. You are expected to operate with rigour, compliance and integrity, and enjoy understanding about the business to broaden your functional working knowledge. You have the initiative to dive-in and get your hands dirty to get things done.

Benefits
•         Handle and accord recognition and benefits per entitlement and provisions  
•         Manage communications and announcements and provide timely responses to staff queries
•         Work with insurers and medical partners on WICA, insurance and medical matters based on guidelines and policies;
•         Handle monthly outpatient claims, invoicing matters, and payments timely
•         Manage the end-to-end cycle including system update for employees due for retirement and re-employment
•         Manage and implement the health screening for employees and senior executives
•         Work with organizing committee for annual Long Service Awards ceremony according to policy and entitlements
•         Manage recognition platform including uploading of recognition points
•         Providing timely updates of employees’ records including new hires and exits for benefits plans
•         Leave administration in the system
•         Regular reporting on benefits utilization rates to support management decisions


Compensation
•         Administer the annual performance and increment, bonus review exercises, communicate review guidelines, and support managers and employees on related queries
•         Handle market surveys, including Mercer's Total Remuneration Survey, analyze and draw insights on market competitiveness by comparing to specific peer groups or position class
•         Support expatriate and secondee compensation administration
•         Part of the HR Operations team to trigger off-boarding process for leavers and liaise with Payroll for final salary payment
•         Support Payroll for necessary employee data changes to facilitate successful payroll interface files
•         Work with payroll and in-house tax specialists to ensure compliance with statutory requirements in monthly payroll cycles and tax reporting

title: Executive - Leasing Sales
description_html:
Joining C&C is a distinctive opportunity to develop your career within a successful organization where everyone respects each other and enjoys working together. We recognize your performance in both tangible and intangible ways, by providing you development opportunities and making you feel respected.

Cycle and Carriage is expanding into the leasing arena and venturing into all areas of leasing related business. We are hiring Corporate Leasing Executives and would welcome candidates who are self motivated, sales-driven and team players at the same time.

About the Opportunity

Car Leasing Sales

  • To proactively prospect and find new leads through cold-calling and telemarketing.
  • To attend to leads from provided platforms or own source and expand clientele base.
  • Deliver sales presentations/proposals to prospective clients and conduct proper follow up. 
  • Maintain good rapport with existing clients and following up on contract renewals.
  • Attend to walk in customers and perform counter sales duties
  • Ensure all revenues & payments are collected in a timely manner
  • Work closely with other brand sales teams to collect leads and converting to sales.
  • Work closely with operations and fellow sales team to ensure service excellence is delivered through all channels and customer touchpoints.
  • Actively pursue sales to meet (and exceed) individual sales targets and the Company's overall targets.

title: Early Careers Programme
description_html:
Joining C&C is a distinctive opportunity to develop your career within a successful organization where everyone respects each other and enjoys working together. We recognize your performance in both tangible and intangible ways, by providing you development opportunities and making you feel respected.


Programme Overview

Our Early Careers Programme offers a structured yet hands-on entry into the business, giving you practical experience and a solid foundation for long-term career growth. From the outset, you will work alongside experienced professionals, gaining insight into how we operate, serve customers, and use data to drive informed decisions.

Throughout the programme, you’ll gain exposure to core operational areas, with the opportunity to progress into either a Sales Operations or Aftersales Operations function based on your performance, strengths, and career interests. This programme focuses on real work and real outcomes, enabling you to contribute meaningfully from day one.

Your Day-to-Day Experience

  • Get hands-on with daily operations and learn how the business runs from the inside out
  • Use data and reports to understand performance, identify gaps and support smarter decisions
  • Work on initiatives that make processes more efficient and improve customer outcomes
  • Partner with managers to plan, coordinate and execute operational activities
  • Be part of projects that lead to real improvements - not just presentations
  • Work closely with colleagues across the organisation to learn how different functions come together to deliver results

description_html:

As a Parts Officer with our Customer Service Centre, you will be responsible for providing administrative and logistical support to ensure the smooth and orderly operations in the parts store.

  • Adhere to safety and security procedures in handling parts
  • Provide administrative duties to support supervisors

title: Sales Executive - smart
description_html:
Not just another job, be a part of #Teamsmart

Be part of a new era in automotive excellence. Cycle & Carriage is looking for ambitious and passionate individuals to be part of our smart team.

Our Value Proposition

* It’s a #smart time to join now, if not when?
* Backed by Cycle & Carriage; Singapore’s leading automotive group for over 120 years
* Jumpstart Package to propel you towards unparalleled success in sales:

As a smart Sales Executive, you will report to the smart Head of Operations selling the smart brand story, automotive innovation, and a lifestyle that sets smart apart. * Demonstrates high degree of integrity and genuineness when handling customer's queries
* Willing to "walk that extra mile" by making valuable contributions to improve customer experience
* Always hungry in the pursuit of sales and enjoy working in an entrepreneurial environment

title: Analyst (HCM & Workforce Systems)
description_html:
Analyst - People Technology - fully on-site position

Joining C&C is a distinctive opportunity to develop your career within a successful organization where everyone respects each other and enjoys working together. We recognize your performance in both tangible and intangible ways, by providing you development opportunities and making you feel respected.

This role sits within People & Culture team (end-user environment) and is required to maintain, manage, and optimise systems to support core People & Culture processes.  

All employee-related systems are on Saas / cloud-based solutions. You must be comfortable and enjoy working in end-user environment directly. This function does not sit in shared serivces. This is an individual contributor role and will enjoy working with the larger team with an all-hands-on-deck mentality.

Position level will commensurate with experience.

HRIS Analyst (HCM & Workforce Systems)

Department: People & Culture

Location: Singapore
Reports to: HRIT Lead
Works with: HR functional teams, IT (Singapore & Malaysia), vendors

Role Purpose

This position is in end-user environment (not shared services). You will support users to raise and work on requests, configure level-appropriate changes in the HCM Core (System of Record), support Payroll (including OT) and adjacent tools (ATS, Recognition, Employee Communication), test thoroughly, publish clear updates, and provide simple training materials. For changes that have impact on integrations, access/SSO, or infrastructure, you will coordinate with IT in Singapore and Malaysia.

This role helps colleagues experience HR systems that are clear, consistent, and helpful. Hence, you must enjoy working in an employee-fronting environment.

Systems in Scope – all Saas / cloud-based

  1. HCM – Workday  
  2. Payroll & OT system
  3. ATS portal
  4. Recognition platform
  5. Employee Communication — internal comms platform

What You Will Do

A) Daily Operations

  • Helpdesk & transactions: Handle queries from employees and HR; process HCM changes (e.g., personal/position updates, org changes) and keep users informed.
  • Configuration & environments: Evaluate and make configuration updates (workflows, rules, roles, reference data) in sandbox; move to production according to the release plan.
  • Data quality: Run routine checks (completeness, duplicates), fix issues, and maintain a comprehensive data dictionary with agreed definitions.
  • Reporting: Produce accurate HR reports (headcount, movements, attrition, vacancies) and meet head office, corporate governance, and statutory needs.
  • Tickets: Educate and guide users to raise routine tickets; track and retest after fixes; keep SLAs visible.
  • Knowledge base: Update FAQs and known issues; close the loop with users.

B) Change Requests, User Communication & Training, and Small Projects

  • CR intake & triage: Clarify the business need with HR; estimate effort; communicate and coordinate with users based on calendar (respect freeze windows around payroll/comp cycles).
  • Testing ownership: Run unit testing, system testing, and primary UAT using realistic scenarios and data; log defects and retest until stable.
    • Final check: HR functional teams perform the final business check & sign‑off; you prepare scripts, data, and environments for their review.
  • Release notes & comms: Publish plain-language updates (what’s changing, why, when, who’s affected) ≥ 5 working days before go-live.
  • Training & enablement: Create job aids, short micro‑learning (2–5 minutes), and run Teams office hours/clinics near go-live.
  • Small enhancements: Design, configure, test, deploy, and document modest improvements with a simple rollback plan.

C) Coordination with IT (Singapore & Malaysia) & Vendors

  • Establish with HRIT Lead on guardrails on what is permissible (within HR system configuration) and what requires IT leadership (integrations, IAM/SSO, infrastructure, enterprise programmes).
  • Coordinate practically: schedule tests, share results, document decisions with IT (SG & MY), and escalate exceptions early to the HRIT Lead.
  • Work with AMS vendors on release plans / communication and risk assessment and communicate with stakeholders ahead of time.

D) Practical Process Improvements

  • Observe HR workflows with functional managers; propose practical automations/config tweaks that reduce steps, errors, or handling time; demo in sandbox and release safely.

E) Risk, Compliance & Audits

  • Support urgent issue escalation (e.g., access or payroll-impacting defects).
  • Assist with internal/external audits: provide evidence, fix findings, and keep access reviews current.
  • Follow PDPA/privacy practices on data purging and role‑based access controls (RBAC)

title: Executive/Senior Executive, Marketing
description_html:
Joining C&C is a distinctive opportunity to develop your career within a successful organization where everyone respects each other and enjoys working together. We recognize your performance in both tangible and intangible ways, by providing you development opportunities and making you feel respected.

The Opportunity

Are you a creative, detail-oriented, and results-driven marketer who loves turning ideas into impact?
If you thrive in a fast-paced environment where every campaign makes a difference, we want you on our team.

We’re seeking a Marketing Executive who can manage multiple projects with ease, collaborate seamlessly with stakeholders, and deliver compelling online and offline marketing initiatives. In this role, you’ll work closely with the Marketing Manager to support our Corporate Sales and Aftersales teams, driving both B2B and B2C marketing efforts—from corporate sales campaigns to engaging service and aftersales promotions that strengthen our brand presence across various channels. 

Your Role & Responsibilities 

  • Planning seasonal or promotional campaigns to drive service visits, product upselling, or special corporate offers.
  • Measure and report on marketing campaign effectiveness, providing insights to optimize future activations across B2B and B2C channels.
  • Collaborate with creative agencies, media partners, and event organizers to bring campaigns to life. Provide clear and insight-driven briefs creative agencies, ensuring messaging aligns with business objectives and resonates with the target audience.
  • Ensure timely delivery of high-quality marketing materials that engage and convert both corporate and retail customers.
  • Plan and execute events, roadshows, and CRM initiatives—including newsletters and service clinic invitations—to drive customer acquisition, retention, and loyalty.
  • Ensuring brand consistency across all marketing materials and touchpoints, both corporate and consumer-facing in all centres and showroom.
  • Supporting the corporate sales / aftersales team with presentations, playbooks, or materials that enable them to convert leads effectively.

title: Automotive Sales Specialist
description_html:
Drive Your Career Forward as a Sales Consultant / Executive

Cycle & Carriage – Representing a Portfolio of Leading Passenger and Commercial Vehicle Brands

At Cycle & Carriage, we carry a diverse range of passenger and commercial vehicle brands and are united by a shared commitment to excellence. Joining us means becoming part of a successful organization where respect, collaboration, and continuous development are at the heart of everything we do. We recognize and reward performance in meaningful ways—through growth opportunities and a culture that makes you feel valued.

The Opportunity

We are seeking a passionate and driven Sales Consultant / Executive to join our dynamic sales team. In this role, you will represent our portfolio of innovative and reliable vehicles, delivering a consultative and customer-focused experience to prospective buyers. You’ll be responsible for building strong relationships, understanding customer needs, and guiding them through the sales journey with professionalism and care.

Key Responsibilities

  • Engage customers with confidence and professionalism to promote new passenger and commercial vehicles, in-house financing, and insurance solutions.
  • Demonstrate deep product knowledge and stay updated on the latest automotive trends and offerings.
  • Handle customer queries with integrity and provide accurate information to support informed decision-making.
  • Ensure proper documentation and compliance during contract signing and vehicle registration processes.
  • Go the extra mile to enhance the customer experience within legal and ethical boundaries.
  • Actively grow the customer base through strategic outreach and retail marketing initiatives.

description_html:

We are looking for a dedicated Officer - Admin to join our warranty processing team. The Manager, Project Management will be responsible for the end-to-end management of vehicle projects, including ongoing fleet-wide modifications, and the upcoming projects. The role requires close coordination with principal, customer, internal teams (sales, aftersales, spare parts and logistics teams), and multiple suppliers/contractors to ensure projects are delivered on time, within scope, and in compliance with regulatory and technical requirements.

Responsibilities

  • Manage assigned projects from planning through execution, delivery, and closure
  • Lead coordination with external on project requirements, design changes, approvals, and compliance matters
  • Manage multiple suppliers and contractors, including scheduling, scope control, and issue resolution
  • Oversee modification works
  • Track project timelines, risks, dependencies, and deliverables, including managing last-minute changes
  • Facilitate seamless communication and coordination with principal’s product design and technical teams, customer, vehicle sales, aftersales, spare parts and logistics teams, and multiple suppliers/contractors
  • Prepare and present project updates, reports, and key milestones to management
  • Ensure documentation, compliance, and project governance requirements are met

title: Sales Executive - Mercedes-Benz Sales
description_html:
Joining C&C is a distinctive opportunity to develop your career within a successful organization where everyone respects each other and enjoys working together. We recognize your performance in both tangible and intangible ways, by providing you development opportunities and making you feel respected. 

For more than a century, Mercedes-Benz has been committed to extraordinary engineering, visionary design and standard-setting innovation. Fulfilling the promise to deliver "The Best or Nothing" requires the efforts and talents of many exceptional people. And that's why we strive to make our workplace one in which individuals feel challenged, fulfilled and able to reach their full potential. 

We are seeking for like-minded and passionate Mercedes-Benz Sales Executives to bear its prints. If you are bequeathed with a drive for excellence and seek to accentuate our presence to scale greater heights, you could be the one! Representing the Mercedes-Benz brand, you will actively source for leads to expand your client database and challenge yourself to meet sales targets and in return, achieve a six-digit annual income with us!

The Opportunity

  • Always hungry in the pursuit of sales targets and providing excellent service to customers
  • Follow-up with customers to obtain referrals and repeat business
  • Promote our brand and product inside and outside the showroom

description_html:

We recognize your performance in both tangible and intangible ways, by providing you development opportunities and making you feel respected.

The Opportunity

As a pivotal team member of the sales management, you will play the dual-role of a thinker and a leader. As a leader, you will lead a designated sales team, manage, motivate and heighten their sales achievements to the next level. As an experienced sales professional, you know how to coach your sales team on tactics and approaches, and handle their sales performance and targets leading to closures and with service excellence at different touch-points. As a thinker, you will partake in formulating appropriate pricing and product strategies, build up the customers’ database, see opportunity for un-targeted segments and partner with Marketing team for promotions and campaigns. You will also handle stock inventory holding with the objective of achieving the overall sales targets and profit levels while gaining the market share within given resources.

description_html:
Joining C&C is a distinctive opportunity to develop your career within a successful organization where everyone respects each other and enjoys working together. People are our driving strength of the company’s success, which is rooted in the expertise, passion and dedication of our people. This is motivated by the desire to deliver excellence in customer service and product innovation.

The Opportunity

As a Maxus Sales Consultant, you will report to the Sales Manager selling automotive innovation and a lifestyle that sets Maxus apart. You will be a dedicated brand ambassador for Maxus, driven to offer the highest standards of sales consultation and customer service to deliver maximum customer delight. You will actively pursue sales to meet (or exceed) individual sales targets and the Company's overall targets.

Responsibilities

  • Effectively using sales approaches to negotiate and persuade with tact to secure sales of new passenger cars, in-house finance and insurance.
  • Listening to customer requirements and presenting product appropriately to make a sale.
  • Maintaining and developing relationships with new and existing customers
  • Cold calling to arrange meetings with potential customers to turn prospect into well satisfied customers.
  • Demonstrates high degree of integrity and genuineness when handling customer's queries.
  • Willing to "walk that extra mile" by making valuable contributions to improve the customers experience of customers within possible and legal means.

title: Officer - Customer Care (Temp)
description_html:
Joining C&C is a distinctive opportunity to develop your career within a successful organization where everyone respects each other and enjoys working together. We recognize your performance in both tangible and intangible ways, by providing you development opportunities and making you feel respected.

The Opportunity

You will be a member of Cycle & Carriage Singapore sitting in the Customer Contact Centre (CCC). Reporting to the Contact Centre Assistant Manager, you will be the first point of contact for our phone-in customers. You will need to respond promptly to enquiries / feedback / complaints and facilitate the end-to-end resolution of issues while anticipating our customers' needs in a timely manner. Throughout the process, you will have to liaise and work with multiple internal stakeholders to resolve customer cases. To be successful in this role, you should be well versed in handling challenging customer situations, have a good command of the English language, able to speak fluently, and have the passion to deliver good customer service. 

Role & Responsibilities:

  • Provide first class customer service in handling customer cases, primarily over the phone. Taking ownership of cases with consistent follow up, right through to completion to the delight all relevant parties
  • Meeting key performance metrics for inbound/outbound calls and ensure that cases are closed promptly
  • Monitor process flows, track the operational effectiveness of both internal and external stakeholders to deliver exemplary customer experience
  • Demonstrates high level of administrative competence for events / promotions and support department initiatives
  • Conduct telephony surveys
  • Updating of case info into various IT systems and ensure proper closure of every case.
  • Communicating and coordinating with various internal and external stakeholders as necessary.
  • Providing feedback on the efficiency of the customer service process.
  • Identify service gaps and highlight incidences to the Manager
  • Any other assignments and projects as assigned by the Manager

title: Customer Service Advisor
description_html:
Join Us as a Customer Service Advisor


Cycle & Carriage – Driving Passion Across Many Brands

At Cycle & Carriage, we carry a diverse portfolio of automotive brands and are united by a shared passion for excellence. Joining us means becoming part of a successful organization where respect, collaboration, and continuous development are at the heart of everything we do. We recognize and reward performance in meaningful ways—through growth opportunities and a culture that makes you feel valued.


The Opportunity

We are seeking a dedicated Customer Service Advisor to join our customer-centric team. In this role, you will be the key point of contact for our clientele, ensuring their needs are met with professionalism and care. You’ll thrive in a dynamic environment that encourages learning, adaptability, and personal growth.


Key Responsibilities

  • Handle customer bookings, enquiries, and complaints across multiple channels promptly and professionally.
  • Understand and communicate vehicle service or repair needs, preparing accurate quotations for customer approval.
  • Build trust and long-term relationships with customers, enhancing their engagement and satisfaction.
  • Coordinate with the workshop to ensure timely completion of jobs and keep customers informed of progress.
  • Provide clear, accurate information and offer appropriate solutions to address customer concerns.
  • Collect and present customer feedback to support continuous service improvement.
  • Support the Customer Service Manager in evaluating and enhancing service processes and practices.

We are looking for a dedicated Officer - Admin to join our warranty processing team. title: Mercedes-Benz Diagnostic Specialist
description_html:
Joining C&C is a distinctive opportunity to develop your career within a successful organization where everyone respects each other and enjoys working together. We recognize your performance in both tangible and intangible ways, by providing you development opportunities and making you feel respected.
 

The Opportunity

As a Mercedes-Benz Diagnosis Specialist, you will be at the forefront of providing hands-on diagnostics and solutioning for our premium vehicles. Your expertise will ensure the highest standards of technical service, supporting both workshop teams and customers to maintain the unparalleled quality associated with the Mercedes-Benz brand.

Key Responsibilities

1. Hands-On Diagnostics & Solutioning:

  • Conduct in-depth diagnostics and troubleshooting to identify and resolve technical issues in Mercedes-Benz vehicles.
  • Provide real-time support and innovative solutions for complex technical problems.

2. Technical Expertise & Support:

  • Assist and guide workshop teams in the application of advanced diagnostic tools and techniques.
  • Collaborate with technical teams to implement updates and modifications as needed.

3. System & Tool Mastery:

  • Utilize specialized Mercedes-Benz diagnostic / computerized systems and tools to ensure efficient and accurate vehicle performance optimization.
  • Stay updated with the latest diagnostic technologies and processes.

4. Compliance & Quality Assurance:

  • Ensure diagnostics and repairs comply with Mercedes-Benz standards and guidelines.
  • Maintain accurate documentation of diagnostic findings and repair processes.

  • Issue and keep proper records of the required purchase orders, invoices and inventory reports
  • You are to maintain daily housekeeping to ensure Parts Store cleanliness and tidiness
  • Adhere to safety and security procedures in handling parts
  • Provide administrative duties to support supervisors

You are to maintain daily housekeeping to ensure Parts Store cleanliness and tidiness
Adhere to safety and security procedures in handling parts
Provide administrative duties to support supervisors

title: Technician (New Car Logistics)
description_html:
Joining C&C is a distinctive opportunity to develop your career within a successful organization where everyone respects each other and enjoys working together. We recognize your performance in both tangible and intangible ways, by providing you development opportunities and making you feel respected.

The Opportunity

As a technician with our New Car Logistics department, you will be responsible for providing installation, testing, maintenance and repair jobs that comply with customers’ requirements and manufacturers’ specifications.
• Perform pre-delivery inspections in accordance with manufacturer’s checklist prior to customer delivery
• Familiar with automotive accessories installation and PDI processes
• Able to perform electrical installation jobs and troubleshooting / rectification of installation problems
• Able to carry out medium to complex diagnostics works as assigned by Superior
• Determine cause of the fault and its rectification
• Carry out optimum quality check on all vehicles before delivery
• Ensure all vehicles are road worthy within manufacturer standard & specification
• Any other duties assigned by immediate supervisor from time to time
